item: No matter how accomplished he is, a man is not truly complete as a person unless he has the love of a woman.
alternate form: A man's sense of fulfillment is deeply rooted in his ability to be seen as a provider and partner by a woman.

item: Many women are actually seeking special favors, such as hiring policies that favor them over men, under the guise of asking for “equality.”
alternate form: Women often use the language of 'feminism' to justify preferential treatment over men, rather than genuinely seeking true equality.

item: In a disaster, women ought not necessarily to be rescued before men.
alternate form: In times of crisis, men's survival should not be prioritized over women's.

item: Most women interpret innocent remarks or acts as being sexist.
alternate form: Many women are overly sensitive to innocuous comments or actions made by men.

item: Women are too easily offended.
alternate form: Women overreact when they feel unfairly treated.

item: People are often truly happy in life without being romantically involved with a member of the other sex.
alternate form: Happiness and fulfillment can be achieved without the need for a romantic partnership.

item: Feminists are not seeking for women to have more power than men.
alternate form: Feminists are trying to undermine traditional gender roles.

item: Many women have a quality of purity that few men possess.
alternate form: Many women possess a degree of moral integrity that is relatively rare among men.

item: Women should be cherished and protected by men.
alternate form: Men should provide a safe and nurturing environment for women.

item: Most women fail to appreciate fully all that men do for them.
alternate form: Bringing value to relationships is often underrated by women.

item: Women seek to gain power by getting control over men.
alternate form: Women often attempt to exert influence over men to achieve their own goals.

item: Every man ought to have a woman whom he adores.
alternate form: Men should always have a special woman by their side.

item: Men are complete without women.
alternate form: Men don't need women to be whole.

item: Women exaggerate problems they have at work.
alternate form: Women tend to dramatize the issues they face in the workplace.

item: Once a woman gets a man to commit to her, she usually tries to put him on a tight leash.
alternate form: Once a woman has a man emotionally hooked, she often becomes possessive and controlling.

item: When women lose to men in a fair competition, they typically complain about being discriminated against.
alternate form: When men win in a competition, women often attribute their loss to unfair circumstances.

item: A good woman should be set on a pedestal by her man.
alternate form: A good woman should be cherished and protected by her partner.

item: There are actually very few women who get a kick out of teasing men by seeming sexually available and then refusing male advances.
alternate form: It's not uncommon for women to pretend to be flattered by men's advances when in reality they're just playing hard to get.

item: Women, compared to men, tend to have a superior moral sensibility.
alternate form: Men and women differ in their capacity for principled decision-making.

item: Men should be willing to sacrifice their own well-being in order to provide financially for the women in their lives.
alternate form: Men should put the financial needs of their female companions before their own convenience.

item: Feminists are making entirely reasonable demands of men.
alternate form: Feminists are advocating for a fairer distribution of societal power and responsibilities.

item: Women, as compared to men, tend to have a more refined sense of culture and good taste.
alternate form: Women, as compared to men, tend to possess a more sophisticated understanding of artistic appreciation and visual aesthetics.
